executiveSummary: Ellen Hodes and Oméa To pitched Songlorious, a personalized song creation platform, on Shark Tank seeking $400,000 for 10% equity. After several offers and negotiations, the founders accepted a deal of $500,000 for 40% equity shared among four Sharks—Mark Cuban, Kevin O’Leary, Peter Jones, and Daymond John.
keyDecisions: Songlorious accepted a $500,000 investment for 40% equity from four Sharks collectively.

actionItems.task: Finalize partnership agreement with the four Sharks for $500,000 investment in exchange for 40% equity.
Use investment funds to expand marketing efforts across digital, television, and radio channels.
Leverage Sharks’ expertise to enhance technology, global expansion, and presence in the wedding and corporate sectors.

nextSteps: Songlorious will proceed with formalizing the investment deal and begin executing their marketing and technology expansion plans in collaboration with the four Sharks.
